commitResults.messageTitle: Implements Level 0 features of the Duke (Re-named to Kniaz for this version) chatbot. This refers to just renaming the chatbot, and implementing a skeletal version that greets the user and exits.
commitResults.messageBody: Adds two new private fields, LOGO and SEPERATOR, to help with this, which hold the logo and horizontal seperator lines respectively (Seperator lines are to help with formatting)

commitResults.messageTitle: Implements level 1 features & adds (public) constant fields.
commitResults.messageBody: Level 1 features just refers to echoing any input given by the user. Also adds a public field EXITSTRING which is the input that will cause Kniaz to exit. Adds private field EXITMESSAGE that is the message that prints on exit.

commitResults.messageTitle: Adds  ability to store text entered by user and display back when requested
commitResults.messageBody:
When a string that isn't interpreted as a command is input, adds it to internal storage. When list is input, displays the list. Note : 'bye' is retained as a command still.

Also adds a new private function to format this task list as a string.
Makes edits to code formatting, functionality is the same. Redundant while statement amended to while(True), and System.out.println of String.format call amended to System.out.printf

commitResults.messageTitle: Adds ability to mark/unmark tasks as done/undone with accompanying message. Adds Task and TaskList classes to encapsulate tasks, and lists of tasks respectively.
Documents additions in previous commit, tagged Proto-Level-3
Implements ToDos, Deadlines and Events, as well as input/output (i.e. commands and printing to Kniaz's command line) for said tasks, and refactors Task printing slightly.
commitResults.messageBody:
Feature expansion to hit Level 4.

ToDos are Tasks without dates/times, Deadlines are Tasks with a singular due date/times, Events are Tasks with a start/stop.

Also refactors Task to be an abstract class for ToDo to inherit from.

This is a slight shift of paradigm, as a Task would be something you need to do, but alone contains insufficient information.

ToDos lack time as it's just something the user has to do -- time isn't relevant here

A deadline naturally has a due date.

Events in Kniaz are defined by start-stop in addition to the name, which is a natural abstraction of an event (Kniaz doesn't care about place (yet?))

Lastly, string representation to output of Tasks in Kniaz's output has been shifted from toString() to toPrintString(), to diffrentiate between input meant SOLELY for the user (which is toPrintString())

commitResults.messageTitle: Patches user-facing string rep of Event, adding a whitespace in front of "from"
commitResults.messageBody:
Needed to make it adhere closer to expected output, as no whitespace means "from" sticks to the previous string

Improves output seen by user

commitResults.messageTitle: Patches user-facing string rep of Event, adding a whitespace in front of "from"
commitResults.messageBody:
Needed to make it adhere closer to expected output, as no whitespace means "from" sticks to the previous string

Improves output seen by user

commitResults.messageTitle: Adds (single) semi-automated test case for use with runtest.sh
commitResults.messageBody:
Allows for quick verification of input/output, comparing EXPECTED against input and actual output.

Expected is to be updated with further edits to behaviour of Kniaz.
